Physical Exam: General physical examination including vital signs (blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, temperature)
Justification: To assess overall health and identify any immediate concerns that may be contributing to fatigue.

Physical Exam: Head and neck examination (including inspection of the throat, lymph nodes, and thyroid gland)
Justification: To check for any signs of infection, inflammation, or other abnormalities that could be related to fatigue.

Physical Exam: Cardiovascular examination (auscultation of heart sounds and checking peripheral pulses)
Justification: To evaluate heart function and rule out any cardiovascular issues that may be causing fatigue.
To assess lung function and rule out any respiratory issues that could contribute to fatigue.
To check for any abdominal issues that may be affecting appetite and overall health.

Physical Exam: Neurological examination (checking reflexes, strength, and coordination)
Justification: To assess neurological function and rule out any neurological causes of fatigue.

Physical Exam: Skin examination (checking for pallor, rashes, or other abnormalities)
Justification: To identify any skin signs that may indicate systemic issues or nutritional deficiencies.
